Class TimeRestrictionManager

java.lang.Object
group33.VirtualPet.src.main.game.TimeRestrictionManager
public class TimeRestrictionManager extends Object
Manager class for handling parental time restrictions across the application. This class checks if the current time is within allowed play hours and provides methods to enforce time restrictions in gameplay screens while allowing access to non-gameplay screens like MainMenu, Tutorial, and Parental Controls.
Since:
Winter 2025
Author:
Team 33 (Dhir, Kostya, Fatima, Anna)

      public TimeRestrictionManager()

  • Method Details

    • isWithinAllowedTime

      public static boolean isWithinAllowedTime()
      Checks if the current time is within the allowed play hours.
      Returns:
      true if time restrictions are satisfied (player can play), false otherwise

    • enforceTimeRestrictions

      public static boolean enforceTimeRestrictions(TimeRestrictionManager.ScreenType screenType, JFrame parent)
      Enforces time restrictions for the given screen type. Shows an alert dialog and returns false if restrictions are enabled and time is outside allowed hours.
      Parameters:
      screenType - The type of screen attempting to be accessed
      parent - The parent component for dialog display
      Returns:
      true if the screen can be accessed, false otherwise

    • checkAndRedirect

      public static boolean checkAndRedirect(TimeRestrictionManager.ScreenType screenType, JFrame currentScreen)
      Updates screen according to time restriction result. If restrictions prevent access, redirects to main menu. Otherwise does nothing, allowing screen to continue loading.
      Parameters:
      screenType - Type of screen being loaded
      currentScreen - The current JFrame that's attempting to load
      Returns:
      true if screen can proceed, false if redirected to main menu
